title: Dragon equipment

properties.name: description
properties.value: Dragon equipment is a range of tier 60 equipment available to members. With the exception of dragon arrows, dragon darts and dragon javelins, dragon items are made of a hard, dark-red metal called Orikalkum, with the former three being made of dragon talons rather than Orikalkum.

content:
The RuneScape Wiki also has an article on: rsw:Dragon equipment
A player with dragon armour equipped.

Dragon equipment is a range of tier 60 equipment available to members. With the exception of dragon arrows, dragon darts and dragon javelins, dragon items are made of a hard, dark-red metal called Orikalkum, with the former three being made of dragon talons rather than Orikalkum.

The dragonkin are the original creators of Orikalkum armour and weaponry, which is nicknamed by adventurers as dragon equipment.

Contents

  • 1 Weapons
    • 1.1 One-handed melee weapons
    • 1.2 Two-handed melee weapons
    • 1.3 Ranged weapons and ammo
    • 1.4 Quest requirements for wielding
  • 2 Armour
  • 3 Other

Weapons[edit | edit source]

Dragon weapons are some of the most powerful weapons for mid-level players, and cannot be made through the Smithing skill. All dragon weapons require level 60 Attack, Ranged in the case of dragon darts and dragon arrows, or Strength in the case of the dragon warhammer; alongside usually requiring the completion of specific quests to wield. Most also have special attacks.

Dragon weapons are very popular with new members with level 60 Attack, as Lost City is very easy to complete and is the only other requirement besides level 60 Attack to wielding the dragon longsword and dragon dagger.

Dragon axe None Need 60 Attack to use Lumber Up spec attack (+3 visible Woodcutting skill Boost)

Rare drop from Zulrah

Dragon 2h sword None Rare drop from Chaos Elemental, Callisto, Kalphite Queen, Venenatis, and Vet'ion

Dragon arrows, dragon dart tips, and dragon javelins are actually made from a dragon's talons and not from dragon metal, which may explain why they are not red in colour and why the darts are the only "dragon" weapon with no special attack.

Dragon arrows may only be fired from a twisted bow, 3rd age bow, or dark bow, which has a special attack that depend on whether dragon or other arrows are equipped. Dragon javelins may only be fired from a heavy ballista, requiring 75 Ranged to wield. Dragon bolts may only be fired from an Armadyl, dragon hunter, or dragon crossbow.

Dragon platelegs000-21-11686663-46500%009.1
Dragon plateskirt000-21-11686663-46500%009.1
Dragon chainbody000-150819398-38200%006.8
Dragon platebody000-30-1510910797-610600%0011.3

Dragon armour is the most common next step up from rune armour, although granite armour, requiring 50 Defence, is sometimes considered the real step up from rune armour. All dragon armour requires level 60 Defence to wear. They are a distinctive dark red in colour, usually with additional details that make them look different from previous armours (like the dragon full helm having spikes) and are generally sold at fairly high prices, or are dropped by high-levelled monsters at a low drop rate.

Dragon armour is considered one of the highest sought-after Melee armour in the game for mid-levelled players. It is often debated whether it is more cost-effective to buy dragon armour or Barrows equipment, since Barrows equipment requires repair every 15 hours of combat, though Barrows equipment has much higher defence bonuses than dragon armour.

The dragon square shield is created by combining a shield left half with a shield right half on an anvil, which requires level 60 Smithing. Note that the Legends' Quest has to be completed to be able to wield or make this shield.

Other[edit | edit source]

A player with gilded dragon armour equipped.

Ornamental dragon armour and weapons have the same bonuses as their standard counterparts. Unlike most other ornamental items, ornamental dragon armour is obtained by using ornament kits on the specific items. These ornament kits can be obtained from the member's only Treasure Trails minigame.

Note: Other players cannot trim items. Players claiming to do so are scammers.
